Interface com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.ads.IVideoAdPackage
Inherited members: ShowHide

View: ClientSubclassPackageImplementation
com.penthera.virtuososdk.client.ads

Interface IVideoAdPackage

  • public interface IVideoAdPackage
    The VideoAdPackage represents the full sequence of ads assciated with an asset. These may have come from a VAST definition and simply be ordered by sequence, or they may be from VMAP and contain full timing details for when each ad should be played. All of the details for playback are stored within the advert definitions themselves.
    • Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      getAds 
      abstract java.util.ArrayList<IVideoAd> getAds()
      This returns an array of IVideoAd objects representing each of the adverts associated with the asset.
      java.util.ArrayList<IVideoAd> getAds()
      This returns an array of IVideoAd objects representing each of the adverts associated with the asset. They are returned in the order they were originally parsed, which matches the order they would be returned in a VMAP response. This array may be empty if no valid adverts were parsed from the original definitions.
      Returns:
      The array of adverts.
      See Also:
      IVideoAd
      getAssetId 
      abstract int getAssetId()
      Get the asset id relating to this package of adverts
      int getAssetId()
      Get the asset id relating to this package of adverts
      Returns:
      the asset id from IAsset.
      See Also:
      IAsset
      getInlineAdResponse 
      abstract java.lang.String getInlineAdResponse()
      This returns a re-constructed VAST or VMAP response, similar to that from an ad server, that can be delivered to a VMAP aware player.
      java.lang.String getInlineAdResponse()
      This returns a re-constructed VAST or VMAP response, similar to that from an ad server, that can be delivered to a VMAP aware player. The response will represent all of the adverts within the package but with local file references and local tracking references, which allow the ads to be played while the device is offline. If the package contains a single advert then a VAST response is returned. If the package contains more than one advert then a VMAP response will be used. If no valid adverts were in the set then the response will be null.
      Returns:
      the player-ready advert definitions similar to an ad server response, or null if no adverts are available.
